info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 4:43AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 515 AM MDT... At 442 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Raton Crews Airport, or 15 miles south of Raton, moving east at 30 mph. A Flash Flood Warning remains in effect for the Raton Crews Airport area until 7 AM MDT. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raton Crews Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 431 and 443. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 334 and 339, and between Mile Markers 357 and 372. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
